pages.text: Depending on the size of the fungi, several fruiting bodies (mushrooms) can be formed. Most $(l:mushrooms)mushroom varieties$() form 5 fruiting bodies in a 9x9x3 meters area.

It takes a certain amount of time for a fungus to reach such a size. In addition, the nature of the subsoil and the ambient brightness must be right. You can read more about this in $(l:mycology/habitat)Chapter "Habitat"$().
